model

Class Fixtures

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Fixtures

  • public class Fixtures
extends java.lang.Object
    This class holds all methods related to communicating with the football data API to return and hold fixture data.

    All fixture objects held in this class are created by the football data API. There is no designed data transfer object.

    Author:
    d_mit

    • Constructor Detail

      • Fixtures

        public Fixtures(com.github.pabloo99.xmlsoccer.api.service.XmlSoccerService xmlSoccerService)
        This constuctor method is called immediately when the application first starts. It is passed the xmlSoccerService parameter from the main method and makes a call to the service to return all 2019/20 fixture objects.
        Parameters:
        xmlSoccerService -

    • Method Detail

      • whatsCurrentRound

        public int whatsCurrentRound(java.time.LocalDateTime today)
        This method returns the current upcomming round according to the date.

        The method analyses all the fixtures and determines what round is being played by returning the round attribute of the next fixture object that hasnt been played.

        Parameters:
        today - the local date time
        Returns:
        the round

      • whatsLastRound

        public int whatsLastRound()
        This method is used to determine what is the last round attibute included in the fixture objects returned by the api.

        It is used in the points history building, to determine what limit of rounds the application should search the database for.

        Returns:

      • startDateOfRound

        public java.time.LocalDateTime startDateOfRound(int round)
        This method returns the start date for a round of fixtures.
        Parameters:
        round - the number representing the round
        Returns:
        the start date of the round

      • getNextStartDate

        public java.time.LocalDateTime getNextStartDate(java.time.LocalDateTime date)
        This method returns the correct next round start date when a fixture round is in the process of being played.

        This method is used for scheduling the next block after a round has started.

        Parameters:
        date - current date time
        Returns:
        start date of the next round

      • endDateOfRound

        public java.time.LocalDateTime endDateOfRound(int round)
        This method returns the end date for a round of fixtures.

        The football data API was returning inaccurate and misleading data related to the end dates of later rounds. This was due to a badly maintained API that was disrupted due to the COVID-19 outbreak. In order to keep the application functioning properly, hard coded fixes had to be implmented to return the correct end dates in the two instances that the wrong data was being returned.

        Parameters:
        round - the number representing the round
        Returns:
        the end date of the round

      • getAllFixtures

        public java.util.List<com.github.pabloo99.xmlsoccer.api.dto.GetHistoricMatchesResultDto> getAllFixtures()
        This method returns the whole list of fixture objects.
        Returns:
        list of all fixtures

      • whatFixturesIn

        public java.util.ArrayList<com.github.pabloo99.xmlsoccer.api.dto.GetHistoricMatchesResultDto> whatFixturesIn(int round)
        This method is used to return a set amount of fixture objects based on the round the fixtures occur in.

        This method is used for returning the next set of upcomming fixtures which are displayed on the home screen.

        Parameters:
        round - the number representing the round
        Returns:
        a list of fixtures
